algorithm_technique: Iterative DFS on a tree to calculate representatives and fuel cost.
Recursive DFS on a tree to calculate representatives and fuel cost.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum fuel cost for all city representatives to reach the capital (city 0).
problem_summary_technical: Tree traversal (DFS) to count representatives in each subtree. Fuel cost is ceil(representatives / seats) for each edge.
key_insights: The problem can be solved using a graph traversal (DFS) on the tree structure.
The key is to calculate the number of representatives in each subtree.
The fuel cost for an edge is determined by how many cars are needed to transport the representatives from the subtree connected by that edge to the parent node.
The DFS function should return the number of representatives in the subtree rooted at the current node.
The total fuel cost is accumulated during the traversal, specifically when returning from a child to its parent.
